If you are not familiar with &6 clean room&r, take a look at the multi-block structure in EMI, you can also check the instructions on the next page

Let's build a 5x5x5 clean room now. You can expand it later as needed. Power it up and let it run until the cleanliness reaches 100%. If the cleanliness is lower than 100%, the machines in the clean room have a chance to eat the items made in it, so you have to keep the clean room running at all times!

Any maintenance problem will reduce the upper limit of cleanliness by 10%. Use the maintenance reminder overlay with redstone lamps to monitor your clean room. Or just use the automatic maintenance chamber to avoid the pain of maintenance.
More advanced chips and circuits need to be made in a cleaner environment, which is why we need a clean room
This is an interesting multi-block structure. You can place various single-block machines inside it to provide the &eclean conditions&r required to execute the recipe!

A cleanroom is a hollow multi-block structure with an overall size between 5x5x5 and 15x15x15. The bottom of a cleanroom does not need to be square, a rectangle will do. The top layer is made of &6Filter Mechanism blocks&r, except for the edges, which are &6Plasticcrete&r blocks. The &6Controller&r must be in the center of the top layer. If the length or width of the cleanroom is an even number, the controller can be placed in any of the two (or four) center blocks. The rest of the structure is made of Plasticcrete blocks.
&e&nBlocks other than the top layer&r can be replaced with any number of blocks:&r

A &6iron door&r lets you enter and exit the cleanroom. Make sure the door is closed, or the cleanroom will quickly lose its cleanliness. &6Travel anchors&r and &6lifts&r can also be used, and can even be &eembedded into the floor&r if necessary.

You can use &6diodes, item pods, fluid pods, or machine casings&r to automatically transfer power and materials through the walls. But you must be very careful when upgrading your internal machines. Be sure to remove the old machine casings and cable diodes and replace them with new higher voltage ones, otherwise you will be sad. If you are just using it to transfer materials, don't worry about the level.

If you want to see inside, use &6Cleanroom Glass&r. If you like, you can even replace all non-top &6Plastic Concrete blocks with &6Cleanroom Glass&r to make it look like a white ocean view house. The power consumption of this multi-block structure is a bit unusual, starting at 30EU/t and then gradually decreasing. But even at 30EU/t, to power it enough, a single LV power tank is enough, and you will often use MV power. Remember that this only applies to cleanrooms, not a general rule.

gto.main-stoneage.quests.3BC9246D8FD4B64: You eventually never heard about GregTech before or be a GT-Veteran. Whatever - this Questbook will guide you through all the important milestones in an easy-to-understand way hopefully!
This modpack has &2significant changes&r in compare to other GT modpacks, so following the questbook should be a good idea.

&7However, the quests won't guarantee that you will have the best experience in every case so you can do things different of course. You will learn how to design and optimize your production and chemical lines which is a fun thing about GregTech!&r
So how to start? Make some flint tools, find a place near water eventually and start building your first base.
Press &e[Tab]&r to open the questbook everywhere and anytime. Most quests can only be completed after you unlocked the previous ones.
&7&o&mThere are also some hidden easter egg quests.&r
&r&4Don't&r overwork too much. Your health is the capital of revolution!

gto.mv.quests.5ACCABFAB15E0A59.descripti: As the name suggests, the machine used for crystallization, &6single crystal silicon&r is a single crystal

When the molten single silicon solidifies, the silicon atoms are arranged in a diamond lattice to form crystal nuclei, and the crystal nuclei grow into grains with the same crystal plane orientation to form single crystal silicon.
This process is generally called &e crystal pulling&r
Crystal formation generally requires &6 seed crystals&r and &6 pure saturated solution&r, and sometimes &6 protective gas&r

gto.tips.quests.1777A96F556AE0F6.descrip: As we all know, Minecraft has a chunk loading mechanism. When the player leaves the chunk for a period of time, the chunk will stop loading - then the machine will not be able to continue running
So for the normal operation of your base, make sure all your base chunks are claimed and &cforced to load&r
&7Click to turn the page to view the operation&r
Press &e[M]&r to open the map, then click or right-click to select the chunk near you, and select &e[Create Territory]&r
Select your claimed block again, right-click and select &e[Mark Force Load]&r
&dNote: Do not claim blocks that are too far away from you, as this will be invalid&r

gto.wireless-energy.quests.0828014567C61: The wireless network has a &ebidirectional&rtransmission rate limit. The power generation exceeding the limit cannot be input into the power grid, and the power generation exceeding the transmission limit cannot be pulled from the power grid
gto.wireless-energy.quests.0EED467C2B883: Before you have a &6Storage Substation&r, you can only use &6Battery Boxes&r as a transmission carrier for the &eWireless Network&r

The &enumber and level of batteries in the &6Battery Box&r determines the single transmission limit. Each battery can provide power equivalent to 1A current of its voltage level. For example, &64x any small battery&r can provide a single transmission limit of &24*32=128 EU/t&r
The battery box itself &edoes not affect the transmission limit&r. You only need to make a &616x battery box&r, and then replace the batteries as you need to increase the transmission limit
&nHold &6 Wireless Energy Binding Tool&r&nAim at &6 Battery Box&r&nRight-click to bind container&r
gto.wireless-energy.quests.1506E8C557277: A cover plate for single-block machines. Only one can be installed per machine
Can be installed on the battery box
gto.wireless-energy.quests.20B8E68273D7D: Thanks to the wireless energy system provided by GTMThings, Grey employees no longer need to deploy the spaghetti energy network

Although you can make &6Wireless Energy Interfaces&r and &6Wireless Energy Receivers&r in the &7LV&r stage, you need to be able to build &6Wireless Energy Towers&r in the &bMV&r stage before you can start to build a complete wireless network

To use the wireless network, you need to build battery boxes/energy storage substations and energy storage depots. The former determines your &etransmission limit per tick&r, and the latter determines the &egrid capacity&r
gto.wireless-energy.quests.27743BDBF0CBE: Installed on the wireless energy tower, it emits redstone signals based on the percentage/absolute value of the power grid and the set maximum and minimum thresholds, with RS latch function
gto.wireless-energy.quests.2F9D9F9271159: Energy storage for the wireless network requires a carrier
&6Wireless Energy Tower&r and &6Wireless Energy Unit&r provide the corresponding functions. You only need one of these structures
gto.wireless-energy.quests.3D4EDD8BE3A2A: Thanks to the changes in the new wireless network mechanism, you can control the &dstart and stop&r of the &esupply side/demand side&r of the power grid&ethrough the redstone signals actively sent by the wireless network
It can realize &dintelligent power generation and production&r to a considerable extent, reducing resource waste!
&eInstall an energy detection cover plate on the main block of the wireless energy tower, and you can send a redstone signal according to the percentage of wireless network power&r
gto.wireless-energy.quests.45A7EB99929CD: &6Energy Storage Substation&ris a powerful wireless transmission carrier. The number and level of &eLamberton capacitors installed inside&rdetermine the upper limit of a single transmission

Each capacitor can provide a power limit equivalent to its voltage level 32A current. The total transmission limit of &6 energy storage substation&r is the sum of the power limits provided by &e capacitors&r
&d Energy storage substation can accommodate up to 18 layers of capacitors&r
&nHold &6 wireless energy binding tool&r&nAim at &6 substation&r&nRight-click to bind the container&r
gto.wireless-energy.quests.4E01E0067B982: As the name suggests, it is used to monitor the operating status of the wireless network
The main information displayed on the monitor interface:
·Total energy: Determined by the &6Energy Unit&r&rlevel and quantity&r of the &6Wireless Energy Tower&r
·Single transmission limit: Determined by the &6Battery Box&r or &6Energy Storage Substation&r&rtransmission limit&r
·Positive net power: Indicates that the system is generating electricity and the energy is flowing into the grid
·Negative net power: Indicates that the system is using electricity and the energy is flowing out of the grid
gto.wireless-energy.quests.50BD070E09091: The &estructural glass grade of the &6Wireless Energy Tower&r determines the &6Energy Units&r that can be effective. Be sure to use &6structural glass&r of a grade no lower than the &6Energy Units&r you installed
&2Total capacity = &nThe sum of the &r&2Energy Unit capacities in effect*Number of units/2&r&r
&dThe Wireless Energy Tower can accommodate up to 30 layers of Energy Units

&r&7To quickly and cheaply increase the total capacity of your power grid, you can stack a lot of low-level energy cells, but this will require you to replace a lot of low-level cells to reduce losses&r
gto.wireless-energy.quests.5E2410977FB75: Mounted on a wireless energy tower, emits a redstone signal with a strength of 0-15 based on the current power/total capacity percentage of the power grid
gto.wireless-energy.quests.6AB84D44D2BB0: &6Wireless Energy Warehouse&r can draw power directly from the wireless network
It is also subject to the upper limit of a single transmission
gto.wireless-energy.quests.7110B5380C210: &6Wireless Energy Interface&r is responsible for receiving power from the generator and sending it to the power grid
The power input to the power grid through the &6Wireless Energy Interface&r has an energy loss of &210%%
gto.wireless-energy.quests.7A4094388C408: &6Wireless Power Cell&r can push power directly to the wireless network
Also subject to the upper limit of a single transmission
